These include a smaller pool of investors and less access to networking opportunities in comparison to urban areas. Urban entrepreneurs often benefit from being in close proximity to established startup ecosystems, experienced mentors, and a larger talent pool. Additionally, rural businesses may be perceived as having limited scalability, given the smaller local markets and potentially less infrastructure for rapid growth. The lack of visibility and difficulty in conducting due diligence in remote locations can also deter investors. Lastly, rural ventures may not align with the typical high-growth, tech-focused investment portfolios of many VCs.
